title.narrative: Support of incubators for entrepreneurship in Madagascar

description.narrative: each year. The situation is particularly worrying in the agricultural sector, which employs nearly 80% of the population and is experiencing a steady decline due to the deterioration of the environment (soil, water, climate change). The country#s vast territory is also managed in a very centralized manner and the infrastructure is particularly lacking in the regions. In this context, after finishing their education , young people try to create their own jobs, but without experience and with few resources, little management capacity and few contacts, they end up often entering the informal sector. To overcome this challenge, initiatives to support entrepreneurship have multiplied in the country over the last ten years. These initiatives, called incubators, offer training and support services ranging from developing a project idea, to the formulation of a business plan to be submitted to financial institutions. However, these initiatives remain limited in scope and diverse in quality, and lack coordination. Faced with this situation, this project is part of the Action Programme to support incubators for entrepreneurship and the creation of MSMEs in Madagascar, Angola, Ethiopia and Somalia financed by the EU. In Madagascar, the project intends to coordinate and strengthen the incubation ecosystem so that it can
